lexUnit.name: prone.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: likely or liable to suffer from, do, or experience (something unfortunate)

sentence.text: Avoid geraniums with double or semi-double flowers as , unlike the single varieties they do n't drop their petals as they fade , and the blooms are prone to rot in wet weather .
Unfortunately , it is all too obvious that voluntary agreements among small groups need not be efficient : when the numbers are small , markets are prone to fail .

This short length of the female urethra , combined with the closeness of the vagina and anus , explains why women are so much more prone to infections of the bladder than are men .
